result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Bail/bond hearing on November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.

1:26 PM Defendant Bradford B Stops in court, in custody.  Attorney Jason Daniel Baltz appeared by Zoom for Bradford B Stops. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Attorney Baltz previously filed a motion to modify bail. Court notes the Trial Court asked for the motion to be addressed today before the Commissioner. Attorney Baltz makes arguments in support of his motion. The State would object to the motion being heard today as the State is not in compliance with Victim notification. The Court will not make any modifications to bail today and will look for a quick date before the Trial Court. Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived. Bail remains as fixed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Affidavit of Service for Protective Order, served to the defendant on 10/21/2022, filed by the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.

Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of the Conditions of Bradford B. Stops' Cash Bail, filed by Attorney Baltz.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 10/26/2022 - Due to the ongoing jury trial in Branch 2, the Court will authorize the court commissioner to address this motion on Thursday.**
Request to appear via zoom for Status of Counsel.

ADDRESS INFO for Bradford B Stops
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W. Moreland Boulevard, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 10-20-2022)
Prior: W145 N8273 Honey Ln, Menomonee Falls, WI 53051

Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to have no contact with victim/victim's child or victim's child's school listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court. Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim A and victim A's child, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school , day care, Franklin Dr. or anywhere they frequent.  Except the defendant can be at his home which is within in the mile of the school.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release. Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) prior to being released from custody/within 24 hours of release from custody.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance,  duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.

2:41 PM Defendant Bradford B Stops in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer, as a friend of the court in court for Bradford B Stops.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.   
Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. 
Court finds this complaint mirrors the complaint filed in 22 CM 1829.  Court dismisses count #2 as it is multiplicities.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on October 20th, 2022.
